newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's Lenzing to raise fibre prices.
newsitem.headline: Austria's Lenzing to raise fibre prices.

text.p: Austria's Lenzing AG, the world's leading manufacturer of cellulose fibres, said on Friday it would increase fibre prices five percent from the second quarter of 1997.
The move would follow a price hike of five percent earlier this year, but prices would remain at a low level, Lenzing said in a statement.

The company said fibre prices had dropped by more than 30 percent between 1990 and 1996 and it aimed to take advantage of the current improvement in the markets. Lenzing said it would continue to raise prices of viscose fibres gradually in order to cover costs.
Earlier this month Lenzing reported a pretax loss of 160 million schillings and said no improvement of the group's earnings could be expected in 1997.
Lenzing's poor financial performance in 1996 and its present situation were the result of a global weakness in the textile markets, the company said.
But Lenzing said it would go ahead with cost-cutting measures which should help earnings improve in 1998. -- Vienna newsroom, Christian Gutlederer +43 1 531 12 275
